text: I'm used that in Objective-C I've got this construct:

code:
- (void)init {
    if (self = [super init]) {
        // init class
    }
    return self;
}

text: Should Python also call the parent class's implementation for __init__?

code:
class NewClass(SomeOtherClass):
    def __init__(self):
        SomeOtherClass.__init__(self)
        # init class

text: Is this also true/false for __new__() and __del__()?
Edit: There's a very similar question: Inheritance and Overriding__init__in Python
